titleStmt.title: The protestation of the rebels in Ireland and how they were beaten at the Castle of Baltimore, and ten thousand of them slaine. With, a relation of a great battell fought betweene Captaine Nuse, a valiant souldier, and Tead-Rast the great rebel; who after a bloudy skirmish five thousand of the rebels appeared to be slaine, and he with the rest fled. And how Captaine Nuse is going to relieve the Castle of Baltimore. January, 15. 1642. And the commanders names taken out of Master Bradshawes letter.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
